snippet: The Japanese authorities arrested 14 Chinese citizens on Wednesday after some of them staged a protest by landing a vessel on a Japanese-controlled island that is also claimed by China.
abstract: Japanese authorities arrest 14 Chinese citizens from a Hong Kong-based vessel after some of them staged a protest by landing on the Japanese-controlled Senkaku Islands; the land is also claimed by China, where it is known as the Diaoyu; incident adds to a recent flare-up between Japan and its Asian neighbors over history and territory.

byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong, and Choe Sang-hun from Seoul, South Korea.

lead_paragraph: The Japanese authorities arrested 14 Chinese citizens on Wednesday after some of them staged a protest by landing a vessel on a Japanese-controlled island that is also claimed by China.

headline.seo: 14 Chinese Arrested After Landing on Japan-Controlled Island
headline.main: Japan Holds 14 Chinese in Island Landing
headline.print_headline: Japan Holds 14 Chinese in Island Landing
